info.description:
These APIs allow you to interact with HubSpot's Marketing Events Extension. It allows you to:
* Create, Read or update Marketing Event information in HubSpot
* Specify whether a HubSpot contact has registered, attended or cancelled a registration to a Marketing Event.
* Specify a URL that can be called to get the details of a Marketing Event.
info.title: Marketing Events Extension

tags.description: Operations to interact with URL settings for an external application.
tags.name: Settings

tags.description: Endpoints that allow you to create or modify the state of an individual Marketing Event in HubSpot.
tags.name: Basic

tags.description: Endpoints that allow you to create or modify the state of multiple Marketing Events in HubSpot.
tags.name: Batch

tags.description: Endpoints that allow you to search for Marketing Events in HubSpot.
tags.name: Search

tags.description: Operations to mark HubSpot contacts as registered, attended or cancelled a registration to a Marketing Event.
tags.name: Subscriber State Changes

post.description: Creates a new marketing event in HubSpot

requestBody.description: The details of the marketing event to create

post.description: Bulk delete a number of marketing events in HubSpot

requestBody.description: The details of the marketing events to delete

get.description: Search for marketing events that have an event id that starts with the query string

parameters.description: The partial event id to search for
parameters.name: q

post.description: Upset multiple Marketing Event. If there is an existing Marketing event with the specified id, it will be updated; otherwise a new event will be created.

requestBody.description: The details of the marketing events to upsert

post.summary: Create or update multiple marketing events

delete.description: Deletes an existing Marketing Event with the specified id, if one exists.

parameters.description: The id of the marketing event to delete
parameters.name: externalEventId

parameters.description: The account id associated with the marketing event
parameters.name: externalAccountId

get.description: Returns the details of the Marketing Event with the specified id, if one exists.

parameters.description: The id of the marketing event to return
parameters.name: externalEventId

parameters.description: The account id associated with the marketing event
parameters.name: externalAccountId

patch.description: Updates an existing Marketing Event with the specified id, if one exists.

parameters.description: The id of the marketing event to update
parameters.name: externalEventId

parameters.description: The account id associated with the marketing event
parameters.name: externalAccountId

requestBody.description: The details of the marketing event to update

put.description: Upsets a Marketing Event. If there is an existing Marketing event with the specified id, it will be updated; otherwise a new event will be created.

parameters.description: The id of the marketing event to upsert
parameters.name: externalEventId

requestBody.description: The details of the marketing event to upsert

put.summary: Create or update a marketing event

post.description: Mark a marketing event as cancelled.

parameters.description: The id of the marketing event to mark as cancelled
parameters.name: externalEventId

parameters.description: The account id associated with the marketing event
parameters.name: externalAccountId

post.summary: Mark a marketing event as cancelled

post.description: Record a subscription state between multiple HubSpot contacts and a marketing event, using contact email addresses.

parameters.description: The id of the marketing event
parameters.name: externalEventId

parameters.description: The new subscriber state for the HubSpot contacts and the specified marketing event
parameters.name: subscriberState

parameters.description: The account id associated with the marketing event
parameters.name: externalAccountId

requestBody.description: The details of the contacts to subscribe to the event

post.description: Record a subscription state between multiple HubSpot contacts and a marketing event, using HubSpot contact ids.

parameters.description: The id of the marketing event
parameters.name: externalEventId

parameters.description: The new subscriber state for the HubSpot contacts and the specified marketing event
parameters.name: subscriberState

parameters.description: The account id associated with the marketing event
parameters.name: externalAccountId

requestBody.description: The details of the contacts to subscribe to the event

get.description: Retrieve the current settings for the application.

parameters.description: The id of the application to retrieve the settings for.
parameters.name: appId

post.description: Create or update the current settings for the application.

parameters.description: The id of the application to update the settings for.
parameters.name: appId

BatchInputMarketingEventEmailSubscriber.description: List of marketing event details to create or update

inputs.description: List of marketing event details to create or update

BatchInputMarketingEventSubscriber.description: List of HubSpot contacts to subscribe to the marketing event

inputs.description: List of HubSpot contacts to subscribe to the marketing event

example.message: Invalid input (details will vary based on the error)

correlationId.description: A unique identifier for the request. Include this value with any error reports or support tickets

links.description: A map of link names to associated URIs containing documentation about the error or recommended remediation steps

message.description: A human readable message describing the error along with remediation steps where appropriate

subCategory.description: A specific category that contains more specific detail about the error

code.description: The status code associated with the error detail

in.description: The name of the field or parameter in which the error was found.

message.description: A human readable message describing the error along with remediation steps where appropriate

subCategory.description: A specific category that contains more specific detail about the error

appId.description: The id of the application the settings are for

eventDetailsUrl.description: The url that will be used to fetch marketing event details by id
The url that will be used to fetch marketing event details by id. Must contain a `%s` character sequence that will be substituted with the event id. For example: `https://my.event.app/events/%s`

customProperties.description:
A list of PropertyValues. These can be whatever kind of property names and values you want. However, they must already exist on the HubSpot account's definition of the MarketingEvent Object. If they don't they will be filtered out and not set.
In order to do this you'll need to create a new PropertyGroup on the HubSpot account's MarketingEvent object for your specific app and create the Custom Property you want to track on that HubSpot account. Do not create any new default properties on the MarketingEvent object as that will apply to all HubSpot accounts.

endDateTime.description: The end date and time of the marketing event.

eventCancelled.description: Indicates if the marketing event has been cancelled.  Defaults to `false`

eventDescription.description: The description of the marketing event.

eventName.description: The name of the marketing event.

eventOrganizer.description: The name of the organizer of the marketing event.

eventType.description: Describes what type of event this is.  For example: `WEBINAR`, `CONFERENCE`, `WORKSHOP`

eventUrl.description: A URL in the external event application where the marketing event can be managed.

externalAccountId.description: The accountId that is associated with this marketing event in the external event application.

externalEventId.description: The id of the marketing event in the external event application.

startDateTime.description: The start date and time of the marketing event.

customProperties.description:
A list of PropertyValues. These can be whatever kind of property names and values you want. However, they must already exist on the HubSpot account's definition of the MarketingEvent Object. If they don't they will be filtered out and not set.
In order to do this you'll need to create a new PropertyGroup on the HubSpot account's MarketingEvent object for your specific app and create the Custom Property you want to track on that HubSpot account. Do not create any new default properties on the MarketingEvent object as that will apply to all HubSpot accounts.

eventCancelled.description: Indicates if the marketing event has been cancelled.

eventDescription.description: The description of the marketing event.

eventName.description: The name of the marketing event.

eventOrganizer.description: The name of the organizer of the marketing event.

eventType.description: The type of the marketing event.

eventUrl.description: The URL in the external event application where the marketing event can be managed.

startDateTime.description: The start date and time of the marketing event.

email.description: The email address of the contact in HubSpot to associate with the event. Note that the contact must already exist in HubSpot; a contact will not be created.

interactionDateTime.description: The date and time at which the contact subscribed to the event.

appId.description: The id of the application that created the marketing event in HubSpot.

externalAccountId.description: The accountId that is associated with this marketing event in the external event application.

externalEventId.description: The id of the marketing event in the external event application.

customProperties.description:
A list of PropertyValues. These can be whatever kind of property names and values you want. However, they must already exist on the HubSpot account's definition of the MarketingEvent Object. If they don't they will be filtered out and not set.
In order to do this you'll need to create a new PropertyGroup on the HubSpot account's MarketingEvent object for your specific app and create the Custom Property you want to track on that HubSpot account. Do not create any new default properties on the MarketingEvent object as that will apply to all HubSpot accounts.

startDateTime.description: The start date and time of the marketing event.

attendees.description: The number of HubSpot contacts that attended this marketing event.

cancellations.description: The number of HubSpot contacts that registered for this marketing event, but later cancelled their registration.

In order to do this you'll need to create a new PropertyGroup on the HubSpot account's MarketingEvent object for your specific app and create the Custom Property you want to track on that HubSpot account. noShows.description: The number of HubSpot contacts that registered for this marketing event, but did not attend. This field only had a value when the event is over.

registrants.description: The number of HubSpot contacts that registered for this marketing event.

interactionDateTime.description: The date and time at which the contact subscribed to the event.
